alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:31PM EST until January 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes affecting Passaic, Morris and Bergen Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Pompton Lakes...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River at Pompton Lakes. * WHEN...From late tonight to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Nuisance, low lying flooding, occurs near the dam in the Pompton Lakes. At 11.5 feet, South section of Pompton Lakes experiences flooding. At 12.5 feet, Several residences in Pompton Lakes, along Riveredge Drive, take on water. At 13.5 feet, Hamburg Turnpike is closed between Route 202 and Riverview Road. Many residences are flooded south of Dawes Highway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 12.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 12/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Ramapo River Pompton Lakes 11.5 9.4 Tue 10 p 12.2 10.0 12.9 1pm 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1045 AM EST.
